prompt: Think about a time when you stopped to look at something beautiful (like a sunset or a flower). Describe the experience. Include Specific details.
sample: This is not exactly something that is beautiful but cute! it was just yesterday. I went to an apartment building a couple of blocks from my place to survey the general area that my brother is thinking about moving to from a different city, just to help him check on the general state of the building, the vibe of the street, and the parking situation. I saw two cats lounging by the window of the apartment on the first floor. I didn't give much attention to the cats at first because I didn't want to seem to pry, but as I was walking around the building, I noticed that the cats were hopping from one window to another to continue to look at me. I couldn't leave but had to stop and revel in the cuteness of one of the cats because it was practically straining against the window screen to reach me!

prompt: People write for many reasons, whether it's for self-expression, communication, or professional endeavors. When do individuals choose to write, and what motivates them? Explore what aspects of writing they might enjoy, and identify the challenges they may encounter during the process.
sample: People write for many reasons, such as self-expression, communication, or as part of professional work. Often, people choose to write when they want to share their thoughts or emotions, or simply explain something clearly. I think the motivation usually comes from a desire to express oneself, connect with others, or reach a personal or career goal. There is also something enjoyable, maybe even relaxing, about shaping ideas into words and seeing them come together. Writing can feel rewarding, as it gives a sense of progress and creates a chance to reach other people. In the end, it is a practical way to be creative and to share something that might matter not just to the writer, but to others too.
